titles.title: HP787 A glorious company we sing

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
A glorious company we sing,
The Master and his men:
He sent them forth to tell his love
By voice and hand and pen;
Then with his Spirit's mighty flame
He made their hearts to glow,
And bade them on a troubled world
His grace and power bestow.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
A faithful company we sing,
The steadfast martyr band;
Against the rage of ruler proud
They boldly made their stand;
And still when men defy Christ's name,
The cross is raised on high,
And for his sake his hosts go forth
To battle and to die.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
A company of love we sing,
Whom Jesus called to save
All sick and blind and hungry folk,
The outcast and the slave;
And now when life of man or child
Is hurt by sin and pain,
He calls for eager, willing hands
To share his love again.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
O we would join this company
Of Jesus and his friends;
This church which now in every land
The reign of Christ extends:
And may that Spirit which of old
His servants did inspire
With love and joy and faith and power
Set all our hearts afire.
